column1: '''Mindolluin''' or '''Mount Mindolluin''' was the easternmost peak of the Ered Nimrais ([[White Mountains]]), below and to the east of which stood the city of [[Minas Tirith]].<ref>{{RK

There was an ancient steep path into the southern foothills of Mindolluin, leading to a high hallow far above the city where only the [[Kings of Gondor]] visited. Standing in this spot one could look over a precipice to the towers of the city far below.
Shortly after [[Aragorn]]'s coronation as Elessar, on [[25 June]]<ref>{{App
column2: Chief}}</ref><ref group=note>The date is problematic, as the narrative in the chapter ''[[The Steward and the King]]'' suggests that the sapling was planted ''before'' June.</ref>, [[Gandalf]] took him by the forgotten path to the high hallow where the newly crowned king could view the vastness of his realm.
